intro: Helipterum semisterile, commonly known as the pink sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and pink to purple flowers. The plant features small, linear leaves and produces capsules as its fruit type. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Helipterum semisterile is adapted to arid conditions and is known for its resilience in harsh environments.
